intro: Iphigenia racemosa, commonly known as the racemose iphigenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are usually simple, alternate, and have a distinctive aromatic scent. Iphigenia racemosa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
